content.content: Hey community! This is the ninth edition of the short report on SourceCred’s bi-weekly happenings! We are here again with the latest news about what’s been going on with our favorite algorithm these last few weeks! If you want to check our instance you can find it here. Haven’t you signed up yet? For details on opting in, see Opting in to Sourcecred/Wth is SourceCred?. If there is anything else you would like to see added please leave your comments below.   Announcements Changes in the off-chain incentive system are on! The changes involve the implementation of new initiatives as well as some specific modifications to the SourceCred main instance. We will do user activations every Wednesday from now on. In this way, we believe the opt-in process will be more organized. Payouts will be out next Friday! We will distribute 10,000 DAI based on 25,218 Cred generated last month. Delegate SourceCred payouts also going to be issued next Friday! We will be distribuiting 4,000 DAI based on 6,586 Cred generated. Delegates can track their activity here. Navigate to the DAI Accounts tab  of the Maker instance to see your current DAI balance and total DAI earned.  Newcomers Please welcome @John_Yarwood, @ClausClowes, @Herbalremidy, @Rahii, @Ippy, @JWizard, @One_Pastrami, @TRUEMAKER, and @Joselyn. They are our newest members of the program so If you see them out there, say hi!  Cred Stats In these last two weeks, a total of 14,055 Cred have been generated, with 122 topics and 1398 posts created. We have had two tremendously busy weeks with a lot of activity! As can be seen in both charts, the level of activity and Cred generation has reached the peak of the year, averaging 7,000 Cred per week! Lots of things to discuss, important announcements, and lots of interesting ideas have contributed to this engagement level. It is even clearly seen in the second chart how this period clearly reverses the trend that seemed to be consolidating, with less activity this year compared to the previous one.  767×496 22.7 KB   756×516 12.4 KB  Top 5 Categories Below are the top 5 categories of the period, ranked by Cred generated.     Cred Categorie     6380 Governance   1837 Miscellaneous   1753 RFC   1739 Signal Archive   1550 Latin America    Top Contributions Below are the top 10 posts created in the interval selected, ranked by Cred generated. The Cred minted in these top 10 topics was 11,102 that is, 78.9% of the total Cred for the period in the forum.     Cred Contribution Author     2540.13 Simple MakerDAO — Governance from first principles @Hasu   1837.75 Mandated Actors Neutrality Discussion @hexonaut   1270.46 MIP55c3-SP5: Interim Chief Legal Officer @ACREinvest   1155.78 Can we justify the existential risk posed by PSM-USDC? @ChrisBlec   1143.57 MIP40c3-SP73: Modify Core Unit Budget (EVENTS-001) @Ippy   763.19 Signal Request: Asset Allocation of MIP65/Clydesdale @Allan_Pedersen   628.48 MIP-6 Declaration of Intent – Invest in short-term bonds – Proposal for implementation @backed-finance   607.06 Rethinking PSM-fees @ultraschuppi   592.09 [Signal Request] REPEAL Poll ID-827 Deployment of a Permissionless Open Market Operation Trial @flipflopflapdelegate   563.71 Announcement - At end of term MakerMan will be retiring as a delegate @MakerMan    Top Contributors Below are the top 10 contributors of the last two weeks, ranked by Cred generated.     Cred Contributor     305.07 luca-pro   303.54 Matt-NZ   194.06 Ippy   187.27 TRUEMAKER   180.43 Marian   161.97 Allan-Pedersen   156.68 Sol-Invictus   139.84 Leandro   128.50 FuchoCrypto   119.51 MFeinberg

TheExistence:  We have had two tremendously busy weeks with a lot of activity! As can be seen in both charts, the level of activity and Cred generation has reached the peak of the year, averaging 7,000 Cred per week! Lots of things to discuss, important announcements, and lots of interesting ideas have contributed to this engagement level. It is even clearly seen in the second chart how this period clearly reverses the trend that seemed to be consolidating, with less activity this year compared to the previous one.   Let’s keep going!
Whoa! Wut?! I never expected to be in the top 10. Such pride!
Next you are top 5!
Same here, I didn’t expect to see my name there! Let’s go!!!
LATAM is in the top 5 Categories and I am in the top 5 Contributors! This is a true collective and personal honor
Yessss! Let’s keep going!

TheExistence:  Lots of things to discuss, important announcements, and lots of interesting ideas have contributed to this engagement level.   Definitely read and participated in many interesting discussions in the past few weeks and many important discussions still to be had. Really enjoying being part of the community
TRUEMAKER:  Really enjoying the community   I love this!
Thank you for accepting me into the SourceCred program, I am very happy that I am taking my first steps in the cryptocurrency world with MakerDAO
Thank you very much for the welcome. It is a pleasure for me to be part of this wonderful project called Maker. I will be there to learn and contribute

Thanks to all the team for the excellent work you do with SourceCred.  For the first time I appear in the top 10 contributors and I thank you for this recognition. I have translated this topic into Spanish for the Spanish-speaking community, you can see it here.
congrats! I love to see it!
Well you deserved this spot my dear, great post & comments, keep going
It´s not a surprise to me as you participated actively on every post I saw last week, well done my friend
Same to you my friend, your posts & comments enriching our community it is a pleasure saw you again at the top 5 of contributors.  Cheers & keep going with this kind of efforts.
This topic was automatically closed 91 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.

Hey community! This is the tenth edition of the short report on SourceCred’s bi-weekly happenings! We are here again with the latest news about what’s been going on with our favorite algorithm these last few weeks! If you want to check our instance you can find it here. Haven’t you signed up yet? For details on opting in, see Opting in to Sourcecred/Wth is SourceCred?. If there is anything else you would like to see added please leave your comments below.   Announcements Changes in the off-chain incentive system are on! The changes involve the implementation of new initiatives as well as some specific modifications to the SourceCred main instance. Every Wednesday we activate new users! Don’t forget to sign up! Oops LATAM did it again! Latin America has been the most active category in the last two weeks! Congratulations to the community and each of its ambassadors! Navigate to the DAI Accounts tab  of the Maker instance to see your current DAI balance and total DAI earned.  Cred Stats In these last two weeks, a total of 11,277 Cred have been generated, with 107 topics and 1227 posts created. As can be seen in both graphs, the level of activity and generation of Cred has decreased after the peak of the previous two weeks, although it continues to remain at levels above the average that it had been exhibiting this year. It is worth noting how the second graph evidences the trend of higher general activity in the period compared to the previous year.  Graph SC Hap #10775×501 22.6 KB   Graph2 SC Hap #10759×521 12.1 KB  Top 5 Categories Below are the top 5 categories of the period, ranked by Cred generated.     Cred Categorie     2305 Latin America   1604 Miscellaneous   1596 Proposal Ideas   1471 RFC   1364 Governance    Top Contributions Below are the top 10 posts created in the interval selected, ranked by Cred generated. The Cred minted in these top 10 topics was 7,105 that is, 63% of the total Cred for the period in the forum.     Cred Contribution Author     1232.16 AAVE released a stablecoin @MarianoDP   1222.16 [Signal Request] Reset delegation metrics for Hasu @Hasu   852.55 Argentines seek USD exposure via stablecoins amid surging inflation @TRUEMAKER   766.24 Should Style of Engagement and Communication be a Facilitator parameter? @Doo_StableLab   654.47 [Informal poll] Disable the Emergency Shutdown Module @AstronautThis   632.33 MIP76: Makershire Redux @Aes   593.53 ETH LATAM en Buenos Aires, Argentina - 11 al 13 de Agosto 2022 - Tickets e info @Marian   403.76 SourceCred Bi-Weekly Happenings #9 @TheExistence   379.25 Should governance polls include a gantt chart? @TRUEMAKER   377.31 MKR Token Decentralization Views @lyt    Top Contributors Below are the top 10 contributors of the last two weeks, ranked by Cred generated.     Cred Contributor     360.97 Marian   352.08 TRUEMAKER   224.92 CodeKnight   204.54 MFeinberg   200.37 nahueth   150.03 Moi   133.93 Matt-NZ   123.54 Ippy   111.52 FuchoCrypto   95.08 Joselyn
Hey, nice data! Latam is taking over!
Felicitaciones @Marian por tu post y aparición en el top 10 por 3ra vez consecutiva, buen trabajo
Wooow LATAM Top 1 category and I am Top 1 individual contributor. I can’t believe it
Latin “King” america
Gracias! Y vos fuiste clave para que LATAM sea la categoría que más contribución aportó, gran logro colectivo!
The increase in LATAM participation is really exciting. There are many individuals in the community who are quite passionate, and I believe this trend will remain over time. Let’s go!
How good it is to see the Latam community leading the way.
It makes sense. LATAM has much lower incomes than the US or much of the EU. Sourcecred can be a significant amount of money for people in those countries.

Thanks to all the team for the great work they do with the SourceCred program. Congratulations to all, especially to the Latin American community for the great progress in the contributions to the forum. I have translated this topic to Spanish, you can see it by clicking here.
@Marian Your posts and comments are very knowledgeable and helpful for our community. It is a pleasure to see you in the Top 10 contributors 3rd time in a row.
Congratulations to all the Top 10 contributors and community members whose posts are selected as Top 10. Cheers and Keep going
Thanks man!
A menos que esté equivocando la procedencia de alguno… ¿60% de inclusión latina en el Top 10 de esta quincena? Not bad, Latam. Not bad at all. Mis congratulaciones a todos ustedes, ché.

Not bad at all! Love engaging with the Latam community. Your content is always interesting, would be amazing if more latam topics are created. I would be happy to help with the english translation so the broader MKR can participate as well.
How happy I feel for all of LATAM, we hope to continue like this, always united both the Anglo-Saxon and Spanish-speaking communities, feedback is the key
Thank you, I am very excited because I didn’t think I was going to appear so quickly in the top 10
My man, as I thought your contributions surely will be in the top 5 rank range for a long time from now. Kudos my fren & enjoy it, you deserve it for enriching our community.

Hey there, thanks for sharing bro. As you commented, the core idea & spirit of our LATAM forum is not only translate or sharing the most interesting or important posts at the main forum too forward learning & create our content, to express ourselves & share the vision, thoughts & perspectives to enrich the protocol & develop new ways to improve the mechanisms or create new ones. Long live to DAI.
This topic was automatically closed 91 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.

Hey, community! This is the short report on SourceCred’s bi-weekly happenings with the latest news about what’s been going on with SourceCred these last weeks!. If you want to check our instance you can find it here. Navigate to the DAI Accounts tab  to see your current DAI balance and total DAI earned. Haven’t you signed up yet? For details on opting in, see Opting in to Sourcecred/Wth is SourceCred?. If there is anything else you would like to see added please leave your comments below.   Cred Stats In the last few weeks, from March 1 to March 19, a total of 15,491 Cred have been generated with 131 topics and 1,275 publications created. As we can see in the two graphs below, the activity of these first weeks of March has been particularly intense. In the first graph we see how, after stabilizing in February, activity reaches its peak in early March, even higher than that observed during January after the December holidays. The second graph shows how the Cred accumulated in the period has been considerably higher than that accumulated in the same period last year.   Top 5 Categories Below are the top 5 categories of the period, ranked by Cred generated.     Cred Categorie     6478 Governance   4678 MIPS - RFC   2094 Signal Requests   1989 Core Units - Sustainable Ecosystem Scaling   1892 Signal Archive    Top Contributions Below are the top 10 topics created, ranked by Cred generated. The cred minted in these top 10 topics was 14,196, that is, 91% of the total Cred for the period in the forum. Hey, community! This is the fifth edition of the short report on SourceCred’s bi-weekly happenings! We are here again with the news about what’s been going on with our favorite reputation algorithm in these last two weeks. If you want to check our instance you can find it here. Haven’t you signed up yet? For details on opting in, see Opting in to Sourcecred/Wth is SourceCred?. If there is anything else you would like to see added please leave your comments below.   Announcements April payouts are out! Please check your wallets and keep posting! This April 19951 DAI was distributed based on Cred scores. Navigate to the DAI Accounts tab  of the Maker instance to see your current DAI balance and total DAI earned.  Newcomers Please welcome @brigith238, @adcv,  @MungoBlakey , @CodeKnight , @Frank_Brinkkemper, and @Mamun. They are our newest members within the program so If you see them out there, say hi!  Cred Stats In these last two weeks a total of 7,196 Cred have been generated, with 81 topics and 910 posts created. As we can see in the first chart below, the drop in total Cred production of the last two weeks has stopped, leveling off and starting a slight uptrend. However, as we can see in the second graph, activity levels continue to be lower than those generated in the same period of the previous year.  757×482 22.2 KB   746×515 11.4 KB  Top 5 Categories Below are the top 5 categories of the period, ranked by Cred generated. Hey, community! This is the seventh edition of our short report on SourceCred happenings, the by-weekly round-up with the latest news about what’s been going on with our favorite reputation algorithm. If you want to check our instance you can find it here. Haven’t you signed up yet? For details on opting in, see Opting in to Sourcecred/Wth is SourceCred?. If there is anything else you would like to see added please leave your comments below.   Announcements GovAlpha is implementing a number of improvements to Maker’s governance off-chain incentive system. The changes involve the implementation of new initiatives as well as some specific modifications to the SourceCred main instance. More detailed forum posts describing these changes can be found here and here. Payouts will be out next Friday! We are giving May an extra week to prepare all the changes taking effect for the next distribution. Navigate to the DAI Accounts tab  of the Maker instance to see your current DAI balance and total DAI earned.  Newcomers Please welcome @Sol_Invictus, @Harrizko, @Moi, @rtree, and @JuneS. They are our newest members of the program so If you see them out there, say hi!  Cred Stats In these last two weeks, a total of 8,605 Cred have been generated, with 88 topics and 913 posts created. As we can see in the first chart below, Cred’s generation has stabilized slightly above 4,000 weekly, putting a stop to the drop observed at the end of the previous period. The second chart shows how the last week of this period slightly breaks with the downward trend that we had been seeing in production this year compared to last.  768×499 22.8 KB   743×522 11.5 KB  Top 5 Categories Below are the top 5 categories of the period, ranked by Cred generated.     Cred Categorie     3580 Governance   1642 Proposal Ideas   1440 Core Units   930 Signal Requests   551 Miscellaneous    Top Contributions Below are the top 10 posts created in the interval selected, ranked by Cred generated. The Cred minted in these top 10 topics was 6,597, that is, 76% of the total Cred for the period in the forum.     Cred Contribution Author     1087 [Discussion] Capital Raise @Tosh9.0   1071 Compensation levels in a global organization @purrfection   1050 MIP41c5-SP7: Facilitator Offboarding (Voluntary) - LongForWisdom (GOV-001) @LongForWisdom   871 The Endgame Plan parts 1&2 @rune   827 How Many Delegates Do This As Their Job? @AliceinMKRland   642 [Signal Request] Deploy a Trial Permissionless Open Market Operation & Resurrect the Burn @rema   575 Decentralized Voter Committees: startup phase - Wednesdays 5pm CEST. All MKR holders welcome @rune   527 [Discussion] Is GFX’s Interest Protocol a Direct Challenge to Maker? @Matt_NZ   429 [Informal Poll] Require 2/3 approval to issue MKR or debt @AliceinMKRland   389 Prioritization Framework - Sentiment Polling @prose11    Top Contributors Below are the top 10 contributors of the last two weeks, ranked by Cred generated.     Cred Contributor     238 MFeinberg   236 adcv   230 luca-pro   222 AliceinMKRland   195 Patrick-J   187 purrfection   173 christiancdpetersen   128 Matt-NZ   119 cryptenthusiastic   117 Traster-Tray
TBH-I’m not sure how I feel about these upcoming changes to sourcecred. I will reserve judgment until I see how it plays out over the next month or so.
So this was the last update before the changes?
I think this is after the changes because I don’t see any delegates
Yes. We will apply changes after May distribución next Friday.
Thank you very much for the welcome, I will be here to learn and contribute❤️
Welcome indeed ! What a great time to be coming into the space!
Wow, I have not imagined that I am listed as newcomers. Thanks and I will get context as fast as I can to contribute community.
This topic was automatically closed 91 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.

Hey, community! This is a new report on SourceCred’s bi-weekly happenings with the latest news about what’s been going on with SourceCred!.In this opportunity, we want to summarize the last two weeks of March and the first week of April. If you want to check our instance you can find it here. Haven’t you signed up yet? For details on opting in, see Opting in to Sourcecred/Wth is SourceCred?. If there is anything else you would like to see added please leave your comments below.   Announcements March payouts are out! Please check your wallets and keep posting! This month 25.000 DAI was distributed based on Cred scores. Navigate to the DAI Accounts tab  of the Maker instance to see your current DAI balance and total DAI earned.  Newcomers Please welcome @FuchoCrypto @AliceinMKRland @Muzza @Valen_Gayone and @Piratical. They are our newest members within the program so if you see them out there don’t forget to say hi!  Cred Stats A total of 11.637 Cred have been generated in these three weeks, with 120 topics and 1217 posts created. As we can see in the first graph below, the activity has been steadily declining, approaching the values of mid-February, the lowest recorded so far this year. However, the second graph shows the similarities in production compared to the previous year, suggesting a certain seasonality in the levels of Cred generated.  778×501 24.3 KB   749×525 11.5 KB  Top Contributions Below are the top 10 topics created in the period, ranked by Cred generated. The Cred minted in these top 10 topics was 4,628, that is, 40% of the total cred for the period selected. Many thanks to @TheExistence for the welcome. It is a pleasure for me to be part of this wonderful project called maker.
Welcome welcome !

Hey, community! This is the short report on SourceCred’s bi-weekly happenings! We want to welcome everyone and tell you the latest news about what’s been going on with our favorite reputation algorithm. Thanks to our own DeFi wizard @hernandoagf  for fetching all the data and bringing with the best ideas  If you want to check our instance you can find it here. Haven’t you signed up yet? For details on opting in, see Opting in to Sourcecred/Wth is SourceCred?.  Announcements February payouts are out! Please check your wallets and keep posting! This month 19910 DAI was distributed based on Cred scores. Navigate to the DAI Accounts tab  of the Maker instance to see your current DAI balance and total DAI earned. We are working on some modifications in the implementation and management of SourceCred. We’ll have more news very soon! If you are interested in governance incentive structures and how to strengthen participation in DeFi ecosystems, don’t be shy and share your ideas with us here  Newcomers Please welcome @makercaesar , @Joserjimz , @cryptenthusiastic , @MadShills , @manomad , @zarnaz , @Allan_Pedersen , @Puzzler  and @Traster_Tray They are our newest members within the program, and some of them are also new members of the community. If you see them out there, say hi!  Cred Stats This month a total of 13,967.38 Cred has been generated with 167 topics and 1,414 posts created. As we can see in the two charts below, total Cred earned leveled off in February, approaching pre-December holiday levels, after the spike in activity recorded at end of January.   Top 5 Categories Below are the top 5 categories of last month, ranked by Cred generated.     Cred Categorie     4166 Governance   2726 Core Units - Sustainable Ecosystem Scaling   2360 Core Units - Real World Finance   1750 MIPS - RFC   1502 Miscellaneous    Top Contributions Below are the top 10 posts created last month, ranked by Cred generated. I missed this summary, I like the fresh and new face they gave it, it gives me to understand the great changes that are coming, congratulations to the new ones, I hope their contributions are more than positive and objective to continue generating growth and debate in the most important DeFi protocol at the present time
That your contributions are referential, welcome to all newcomers.
This topic was automatically closed 91 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.

Hey, community! This is the sixth edition of our short report on SourceCred happenings, the by-weekly round-up with the latest news about what’s been going on with our favorite reputation algorithm. If you want to check our instance you can find it here. Haven’t you signed up yet? For details on opting in, see Opting in to Sourcecred/Wth is SourceCred?. If there is anything else you would like to see added please leave your comments below.   Announcements Navigate to the DAI Accounts tab  of the Maker instance to see your current DAI balance and total DAI earned. Soon we’ll have news about some SourceCred modifications, as well as other interesting changes aimed at improving governance engagement.  Cred Stats In the first two weeks of May, a total of 8,511 Cred was generated, with 102 topics and 953 posts created. As we can see in the first graph below, the production has been quite uneven, with significant levels of activity during the first week and a notable drop in the second. The second graph shows how the same situation occurred in the same period of last year. This may be due to multiple factors, one of which could be the structuring of the governance cycle itself influencing community activity. It will be interesting to see the progression in the coming months to see how it continues and to see whether or not we have a trend in this direction.  759×491 22.7 KB   744×521 10.7 KB  Top 5 Categories Below are the top 5 categories of the period, ranked by Cred generated.     Cred Categorie     2725 Miscellaneous   1737 RFC   1240 Governance   798 Updates   797 Growth    Top Contributions Below are the top 10 topics created in the period, ranked by Cred generated. The Cred minted in these topics was 5,729, that is, 67% of the total Cred for the period in the forum.     Cred Contribution Author     1351 The MKR holder Confessional @iammeeoh   718 MIP75c2-SP1: Onboard Task Force - Growth Task Force @hexonaut   617 Decentralized Voter Committee on Tuesday 5pm CEST - all MKR holders welcome @rune   577 Signal Request - Launch Maker Teleport with 1 basis point fee @Aes   573 Maker Wormhole new name: Maker Teleport @tobalgarcia   450 [Signal Request] Maker Accessing Mortgage loans Through Bacon Protocol @abdalla   404 MakerDAO.com performance overview @Mamun   386 Consolfreight Update May 2022: ConsolFreight helps Mastercard to test DeFi @AleG   347 Now there’s a graph!  @Mamun   306 MIP39c2-SP33: Adding Lending Oversight Core Unit (LOVE-001) @luca_pro    Top Contributors Below are the top 10 contributors of the period, ranked by Cred generated.     Cred Contributor     372 Doo-Nam   284 iammeeoh   247 christiancdpetersen   240 Mamun   239 luca-pro   223 ElProgreso   208 Patrick-J   188 MFeinberg   181 adcv   161 Saludiego-201

I am a little concerned about the drop in creed at last year’s levels, what could it mean, less people contributing, less people participating in the debate here, I have noticed that the chain votes are increasing. Maybe thanks to the delegates. I am a bit concerned in the sense of whether participation will be centralized in the forum, which for me is the Layer-0 of governance.

Saludiego_201:  I am a bit concerned in the sense of whether participation will be centralized in the forum   The general trend is concerning. Maybe the people who delegated MKR to recognized delegates decided to tune out of the forum which can increase centralization and regulatory capture. This is kind of what happens in a TradFi company where the board of directors is basically captured by the salaried executives.

It would be nice to have more discussions. I think that is the only way. Constructive feedback wins. I have seen some less than constructive feedback on here which hurts growth and creativity. Let’s keep talking!

ejbarraza:      Saludiego_201:  I am a bit concerned in the sense of whether participation will be centralized in the forum   The general trend is concerning. Maybe the people who delegated MKR to recognized delegates decided to tune out of the forum which can increase centralization and regulatory capture   That could be one of several possibilities. We will be keeping an eye on the data to see if a consistent trend emerges in the coming months. Beyond this, over the course of the week, GovAlpha will introduce a new set of off-chain incentive mechanisms to complement SourceCred and encourage community participation.

Hello there! I wrote this because since last week I don’t see the DAI earned at the Source Cred dashboard and the issue continues, so I have been curious if it my problem or some UX failure.THX  1366×768 71.8 KB

You want to head over into the Accounts tab: http://makerdao.sourcecred.io/#/accounts The explorer tab defaults to “last week” view, and since we only distribute DAI once a month, it will show 0 DAI distributed, unless you are checking the week after we make the payments.

Yup I know it but my question is based on the fact that since two weeks the dashboard hasn’t displayed the amounts per week when before this issue it was doing it. I know because since I subscribed to the program (almost two months) I usually check my status and collect the numbers (cred, %, DAI) to track it daily through a personal sheet that I created for this purpose.

Hi nahueth! We’ve been running with some issues with the automatic updates of the instance for the last couple of days which has caused the dashboard not to display the most up-to-date data. However, we hope to fix it over the course of this week and it should update as expected.
Thanks for clarify the situation my fren! Hope so this can be solve soon, best for the team!
The instance is up to date! We will be running the last distribution of the month this Sunday in order to generate the payouts

Yay! Great job fellas, thx a lot! This data is game changing to me! I agree ! I’m not on many other platforms so I wouldn’t know everything but the functionality behind SourceCred is excellent and obviously it encourages community participation which is key to growth.

Well my fren, me too! I have been reading the most posts related to SourceCred and it is very impressive how it has evolved since it was implemented thanks to the action of the forum community and yes! My interest in knowing the deep mechanisms that run the program here is because I want to collaborate to drop an adjusted version of this on some social projects and run it for the communities that want to reward their members’ apports.

Well one of the keys from the origin proposal to implement SourceCred at the forum was encouraging and rewarding the positive apports from the community, is a way not only to recognize them too to put value on their time & effort expended here. Hey, community! This is the eighth edition of the short report on SourceCred’s bi-weekly happenings! We are here again with the latest news about what’s been going on with our favorite algorithm these last few weeks!. If you want to check our instance you can find it here. Haven’t you signed up yet? For details on opting in, see Opting in to Sourcecred/Wth is SourceCred?. Please leave your comments below if there is anything else you would like to see added.   Announcements Changes in the off-chain incentive system have started to be applied! The changes involve the implementation of new initiatives as well as some specific modifications to the SourceCred main instance. We will do user activations every Wednesday from now on. In this way, we believe the opt-in process will be more organized. Good job LATAM community! Once again we have a post in Spanish within the 10 with more Cred generated! Felicitaciones! Navigate to the DAI Accounts tab  of the Maker instance to see your current DAI balance and total DAI earned.  Cred Stats In these last two weeks, a total of 9,041 Cred have been generated, with 100 topics and 1,079 publications created. As we can see in the first chart below, Cred generation has again stabilized above 4,000 weekly, with some spikes in activity above 5,000.
